definition: zhongruan or alto lute, like pipa 琵琶 but bigger and lower range
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
surname Ruan/small state during the Shang Dynasty (1600-1046 BC) located in the southeast of modern-day Gansu Province
liuqin lute, smaller version of the pipa 琵琶, with holes in the soundbox, and range similar to that of a violin
musical ensemble of several instruments (e.g. duet 二重奏 or trio 三重奏)
jinghu, a smaller, higher-pitched erhu 二胡 (two-stringed fiddle) used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京二胡
daruan or bass lute, like pipa 琵琶 and zhongruan 中阮 but bigger and lower range
guqin or qin, a long zither with seven strings, plucked with the fingers
yueqin, a lute with oval or octagonal sound box
jing'erhu, a two-stringed fiddle intermediate in size and pitch between the jinghu 京胡 and erhu 二胡, used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京胡
